text: Reminder: Remember to log your time in Harvest!

<@U243UT96G> and <@U2670DYLE> joel an di had a meeting this morning. let’s tighten up the feedback loop by checking in and talking more.  in parallel, we’re reaching out to google again this week to see if we can get some insight into showtime rollout

text: the embedded demos are great, and it discusses both code-based and GUI-driven tools in tandem
thanks for this mo, I will check out

that said, do you have an early indication about how you’d like to handle cubby animations for a future project?  See any compelling reasons to getting away from Bodymovin exports? just curious <@U243UT96G> i know we keep coming back to this point

i'm looking at other options, but i keep coming back to bodymovin because a) our animator is happy with AE as the animation tool, b) it's improved in terms of performance and functionality since the last iteration of BL wall
i'm trying to recreate animation from AE in animate cc and it looks janky.  fine-tuned control over tweens etc is not as reliable
we do need to test the latest, as when we were on site and got an update, all the objects it exported were completely black
good points all around
<@U243UT96G> if this is literaly what you are in the midst of, maybe you and peter can look at the black/roken (?) exports and try to better understand that?
yea sure
FWIW, exports were broken such that I/we could not load on the corresponding player. Looked like extra HTML was being tacked on the end of the export.
deployed version was the only one that worked - everything after that was broken
its looking like its been updated since we used it last
at least a couple minor revs
wow there has been a ton of dev done on it since we deployed it looks like, there are a lot of commits in there
i’ll capture thi sin a jira ticket
